title: Drawing, "Textile Design:  Japanland", designed 1923
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink on mount, lower right corner: Dessin: "Japanland"; Stamped in red, lower right corner: WIENER/WERK/STÄTTE; Inscribed in blue crayon on mount, upper right corner: (can't see because of frame)
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: Stylized elongated woman in blue kimono holding fan with floating  blue and plum peony branches and two tiny pavillons against mountain in distance on yellow background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Textile Design:  Japanland", designed 1923.
designed 1923. Brush and gouache, graphite on paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-1035.
